Classes.Name: Basic Attack (P) / Basic Attack (M)
Classes.Effect: A basic attack. The user may choose either BATK (P) or BATK (M). Add the corresponding stat depending on their choice (BATK (P) = Physical Attack. BATK (M) = Magical Attack).This attack can be used even when sealed and its use cannot be prevented by any means, outside of Stun.

Classes.Name: Dash
Classes.Effect: The user may move up to 1.5x their MP (rounded down) instead of 1x. (Dash is a Full Action, which takes up both the movement and standard actions.)

Classes.Name: Backstep
Classes.Effect: The user moves one tile in a cardinal direction without triggering Attack of Opportunity.  This can only be used when adjacent to a foe.

Classes.Name: Attack of Opportunity
Classes.Effect: When a foe in the user's melee either leaves that melee with their movement action, or uses a ranged attack that doesn't target the user, the user may use this move to perform a Basic Attack on them.

Classes.Name: Rising Hope
Classes.Effect: The user and allies within their melee range have +1 ACC and +1 Crit Range. If the user has given a buff to or used Harmony on an ally within the last two rounds, this gives an additional +1 accuracy for one round. Rising Hope does not stack with more than one Bard.

Classes.Name: Harmony
Classes.Effect: For one round, the target cannot be affected by any status or debuff and has any such effect removed. If the target is affected by unremovable Poison, Burn or Bleed upon the usage or during the duration of this move, they gain +3 EVAs, +2 ACC, or +5 DMG respectively for the duration of the status. This move does not interact with self-inflicted statuses or debuffs in any way.

Classes.Name: Encore
Classes.Effect: The user rolls 1d20 and stores the result (this is NOT an accuracy roll). As a Reaction, the user may use, or give to an ally within Range 3, the number rolled as an accuracy check for their attack. This move cannot be used if the user already has a d20 stored.

Classes.Name: Primadonna
Classes.Effect: The targets gain +5 ATK/MAG; as long as those buffs are active, the targets also have -3 unremovable DR on Standard/Full attacks. Either player may choose to lose the buff after one round, on their turn as a Trigger action. This does not stack.

Classes.Name: Crescendo
Classes.Effect: As a Free action, the user and all allies in Star 5 gain +1 ACC and +2 Crit Range until the start of the user's next turn. As a Standard action, this move is instead Global and targets instead gain +10 DMG and +3 Crit Range for one round.

Classes.Name: Invoke: Ice
Classes.Effect:
When targeted with a non- Free, Swift, or Global attack from a foe, the user gains an Ice Stack (max three) after the move is resolved. Only two Ice Stacks may be gained per round.

If the accuracy roll of an attack targeting the user rolls X+, that attack loses one die, where X = 15 - # of Ice Stacks.

Classes.Name: Mist
Classes.Effect: For one round, all attacks made by enemies from inside the user's Burst 2 deal -5 damage. The user may spend up to two Ice Stacks to extend this effect's duration by one for each stack used, or spend three stacks for a duration of two rounds and a range of Burst 3. This move cannot be used again while its effect is active.

Classes.Name: Frost Barrier
Classes.Effect: The user gains a Shield/1 equal to 2d8+X, where X is thrice the amount of Ice Stacks the user chooses to spend, minimum one stack.

Classes.Name: Ice Wall
Classes.Effect: The user creates a 3-tile wall of Ice in a cardinal direction, or a diagonal one with halved length (rounded up). This Ice has 15 HP. Foes who end their turn with at least one of these Ice tiles in their melee take 10 damage. The user may spend Ice Stacks to increase the wall's base length by one for each stack spent. The wall expires after 3 rounds. The user may shatter the wall as a Trigger action after one turn, destroying it and inflicting 3 Bleed/2 on foes within melee of it. This move ignores Range Rule.

Classes.Name: Flash Freeze
Classes.Effect: This player may use this when targeted by an attack after damage has been rolled, and must spend one Ice Stack to do so. The interrupted attack loses all of its additive dice (excluding Critcal Hit). The user may spend an additional Ice Stack to also remove the attack's additive damage buffs, or two additional Ice Stacks to remove all positive damage factors.

Classes.Name: Strike Guard
Classes.Effect: If the opponent rolls 14+ on their accuracy on an attack that is targetting the user or an ally in their melee, the attack deals -5 damage.

Classes.Name: Vanguard
Classes.Effect: This move may be used when an ally in range is targeted by an attack, after damage is rolled. The user moves to a tile in the ally's melee, and the ally takes 5 less damage from the attack. If the user is also a target of the attack, both the user and the Ally take 10 less damage instead. This effect does not stack with multiple Guardians.

Classes.Name: Fortify
Classes.Effect: The target gains X Shield/1, where X is 35% of the amount of damage the user has taken directly from attacks since the beginning of their last turn (max 30 Shield).

Classes.Name: Tenacity
Classes.Effect: This may be used once per turn if the target has not been targeted with an attack for one round. The target heals 15% of their lost HP.

Classes.Name: Radiance
Classes.Effect: The user takes 80% damage from attacks for two rounds. Additionally, for one round, whenever an ally is targeted by an attack from within the user’s Burst 2, the user may use a Reaction to redirect 30% of the damage the ally would take to themselves. (Redirected damage cannot be reduced by any means, nor can it stack with multiple users.)

Classes.Name: Invoke: Fire
Classes.Effect:
When targetting a foe with a non- Free, Swift, or Global attack, the user gains a Fire Stack (max three) after the move is resolved. After gaining a Fire Stack, the user may not gain another one until the start of their next turn.

If the accuaracy roll of an attack by the user rolls X+, that attack gains one die, where X = 15 - # of Fire Stacks the user has.

Classes.Name: Comet
Classes.Effect: The user does the following things in any order: deals damage equal to the rolled amount to up to two foes in melee range, moves up to their full MP range. This move's damage is immune to outside factors. Do not add MAG.

Classes.Name: Ignition
Classes.Effect: The user spends 1 to 3 Fire Stacks to use this move. Their next attack gains 3X Burn/1, where X is the number of Stacks spent.

Classes.Name: Afterburn
Classes.Effect: The user may spend 1 or 2 Fire Stacks to gain +2 or +3 accuracy, respectively, for one turn. An additional Fire Stack may be spent for Invoke Fire to grant an extra dice this turn.

Classes.Name: Kinetic Energy
Classes.Effect: The user may spend two Fire Stacks to gain +10 damage on their next attack, or three Fire Stacks to gain +1 die and +15 damage to their next attack.

Classes.Name: Time Matrix
Classes.Effect: If the user rolls 14+ for their accuracy on an attack, the attack deals +5 damage.

Classes.Name: Rewind
Classes.Effect: This move can be used after the user rolls damage for an attack. The user may reroll up to 3 damage dice, but takes 3% of the attack's damage per die rerolled as recoil. Rerolled dice cannot trigger bombs or inverse bombs.

Classes.Name: Vortex
Classes.Effect: Add 20% of the highest damage of the user's last attack on any target to their next attack (this does not include multiplicative positive damage modifiers).

Classes.Name: Paradox
Classes.Effect: The user may use a Once/Twice/Thrice move without expending a use this turn, even if the move is out of uses. The user may not use Paradox in conjunction with Reaction or Trigger moves. The user takes 20% of the damage from the Paradox move as recoil.

Classes.Name: Time Dilation
Classes.Effect: This may be used when the player is targeted with an attack, after damage is rolled. The attacker takes one third of the damage dealt to the user after the user takes the damage.

Classes.Name: Glide
Classes.Effect: When dashing, the player may move up to 2x their MP instead of 1.5. If they do, the dash caps at 12 MP. Additionally, the player's dash ignores the effects of Slow.

Classes.Name: Quick Thinking
Classes.Effect: The user may use this move after their standard action to move up to half of their MP (rounded down). This movement is unaffected by movement AoO and Slow.

Classes.Name: Stealth
Classes.Effect: This turn, the user’s Backstep becomes a Free action. While under this effect, the user has -2 MP.

Classes.Name: Outmaneuver
Classes.Effect: The user may sacrifice up to 4 unused MP to gain +1 accuracy for every 2 MP sacrificed for one turn.

Classes.Name: Tunneling
Classes.Effect: This turn, the user may move through all tiles and Enemy Players/Monsters as if they were regular terrain, but they may not perform/end any action on tiles that they normally can't move through (Stop, Ice, Broken, or Bone).

Classes.Name: Time's Edge
Classes.Effect: The user's next Standard/Full action this turn adds 25% ATK/MAG. When the user's current turn would normally end, extend it with an additional Standard that does not add ATK/MAG and is immune to all outside damage factors. If the first Standard/Full dealt no damage, all modifiers instead apply to the extra standard (including 25% ATK/MAG and non-immunity to outside damage factors)

Archer.Name: Basic Attack (P) / Basic Attack (M)
Archer.Effect: A basic attack. The user may choose either BATK (P) or BATK (M). Add the corresponding stat depending on their choice (BATK (P) = Physical Attack. BATK (M) = Magical Attack).This attack can be used even when sealed and its use cannot be prevented by any means, outside of Stun.

Archer.Name: Dash
Archer.Effect: The user may move up to 1.5x their MP (rounded down) instead of 1x. (Dash is a Full Action, which takes up both the movement and standard actions.)

Archer.Name: Backstep
Archer.Effect: The user moves one tile in a cardinal direction without triggering Attack of Opportunity.  This can only be used when adjacent to a foe.

Archer.Name: Attack of Opportunity
Archer.Effect: When a foe in the user's melee either leaves that melee with their movement action, or uses a ranged attack that doesn't target the user, the user may use this move to perform a Basic Attack on them.

Archer.Name: Hunter's Mark
Archer.Effect: Whenever the player targets a foe with a Crossbow attack, the target gains one Mark after the attack resolves. When attacking a target with a Mark, the user's attack gains +5% damage per Mark (this does not stack for multitarget moves). Crossbow moves are only affected by Marks applied by the user.

Archer.Name: Arrow Flurry
Archer.Effect: If the original target has a Mark, this move gains Splash 1. If the target has 2+ Marks, this move instead gains Splash 2.

Archer.Name: Arrow Net
Archer.Effect: If the target has a Mark, they are inflicted with Slow/1. If the target has 2+ Marks, the user may inflict the target with 6 Cripple/1 instead.

Archer.Name: Shadow Quiver
Archer.Effect: The user's next Crossbow attack becomes magical and ignores all obstructions in its path (including Air tiles and Personal Bubble).

Archer.Name: Scoping Shot
Archer.Effect: For one round, all attacks on the target gain +1 ACC for every mark the target has.

Archer.Name: Quick Scope
Archer.Effect: Regardless of hit or miss, the user's next Crossbow Standard/Full this turn does not give the target a Mark from Hunter's Mark. This attack is immune to outside factors to damage. Do not add ATK/MAG.

Archer.Name: Explosive Shot
Archer.Effect: The target gains a "bomb". The user may choose to detonate this bomb as a trigger action on their turn, dealing 1d8+2X damage to all foes within Burst 2 of the target, where X is the amount of Marks the target has. The bomb automatically detonates when the user or target dies, or after two rounds.

Archer.Name: Tornado Bolt
Archer.Effect: This move has Push X, where X is the amount of Marks the target has. If the target is unable to be pushed the full distance, the target gains another Mark.

Archer.Name: Pierce
Archer.Effect: If a target has 1+ Marks, this move ignores evasions. If a target has 2+ marks, this move also ignores negative accuracy modifiers.

Archer.Name: Serrated Arrows
Archer.Effect: This move inflicts 5 Bleed/X, where X is the amount of Marks the target has.

Archer.Name: Ballista
Archer.Effect: This may only be used on a target with 2+ Marks. The X in this attack is the amount of Marks the target has.

Archer.Name: Skill Shot
Archer.Effect: This move can be used regardless of the user’s statuses (except stun) or foes’ move effects, and it cannot be prevented from doing damage.

Archer.Name: Chase Arrow
Archer.Effect: This attack is immune to outside damage factors.

Archer.Name: Rupture
Archer.Effect: This attack ignores evasions and accuracy modifiers. If the target has a buff to evasions or the user has a debuff to accuracy, this inflicts 5 Bleed/1 on the target.

Archer.Name: Long Shot
Archer.Effect: This attack cannot have its range reduced. If the target has targeted the user from outside Range 6 at some point, and this is the first time the user has used this move on the target, this attack inflicts Seal/1.

Archer.Name: Bow Slam
Archer.Effect: Targets are pushed in the direction of the cone. For one round, the user is immune to being moved by other players and immune to damage from effects dependent on Push/Pull.

Archer.Name: Turtle Shot
Archer.Effect:
If the target has fulfilled both the below conditions during the last two rounds, this attack gains +3 dice:
 - Not targeted another player with a non-global attack
 - Not taken more than 20 damage from a single source.
 This move cannot be used during the first two rounds of the game.

Archer.Name: Tranquil Technique
Archer.Effect: The user's next attack on a foe cannot have its damage reduced.

Archer.Name: Squall Volley
Archer.Effect: If the user is debuffed from effects originating from foes, this attack ignores those debuffs that the user has and hits thrice instead.

Archer.Name: Arrow Rain
Archer.Effect: Foes hit are inflicted with any status effects the user has. The user may choose to target an empty space instead of a player for -3 accuracy on this attack.

Archer.Name: Shatter Shot
Archer.Effect: This attack's initial damage roll only considers the base roll, ATK bonus and positive damage/dice bonuses. After applying other factors, invert the resultant damage loss.

Archer.Name: Hawkeye
Archer.Effect: Up to twice per turn, the user may choose to sacrifice 5 damage for +2 accuracy and +2 crit range this turn. This debuff is unremovable.

Archer.Name: Blitz
Archer.Effect: For each successful hit, the user gains +2 damage on their next attack.

Archer.Name: Windmill
Archer.Effect: The user gains +X accuracy and critical range on this attack, where X = The amount of foes being targeted - 1.

Archer.Name: Venom Shot
Archer.Effect: This attacks inflicts X Poison/1 on the target, where X is 2* accuracy bonus the user has. (If the user has no accuracy bonus, do not inflict Poison.)

Archer.Name: Homing Shot
Archer.Effect: This move automatically hits the target. (This move still rolls accuracy)

Archer.Name: Salvo
Archer.Effect: When using a multihit attack, the user may choose different targets for each individual hit. When targeting different foes, instead of adding ATK/MAG only to the first hit, add the user's ATK/MAG and +/- damage effects divided by the amount of unique targets to the damage dealt to each foe.

Archer.Name: Dampening Shot
Archer.Effect: If this move deals less than 30 damage, inflict Seal/1 on the target.

Archer.Name: Hook Shot
Archer.Effect: The user may choose between pulling the target towards the user or pulling the user toward the target. This move can be used as a non-damaging standard on any non-player obstruction to pull the user to the target. If the user's accuracy is raised by at least two this turn, this move is immune to negative outside factors to damage.

Archer.Name: Trick Arrow
Archer.Effect: If the user's accuracy is raised by at least three this turn, this move gains Splash 1.

Archer.Name: Sagittarian Pride
Archer.Effect: For each successful hit of this attack, subsequent hits gain +1 accuracy and +1 crit range.

Archer.Name: Arrow Storm
Archer.Effect: This attack critical hits on 18+ and is immune to positive outside factors to damage. Critical hits on this move have triple instead of double base dice.

Celestial.Name: Basic Attack (P) / Basic Attack (M)
Celestial.Effect: A basic attack. The user may choose either BATK (P) or BATK (M). Add the corresponding stat depending on their choice (BATK (P) = Physical Attack. BATK (M) = Magical Attack).This attack can be used even when sealed and its use cannot be prevented by any means, outside of Stun.

Celestial.Name: Dash
Celestial.Effect: The user may move up to 1.5x their MP (rounded down) instead of 1x. (Dash is a Full Action, which takes up both the movement and standard actions.)

Celestial.Name: Backstep
Celestial.Effect: The user moves one tile in a cardinal direction without triggering Attack of Opportunity.  This can only be used when adjacent to a foe.

Celestial.Name: Attack of Opportunity
Celestial.Effect: When a foe in the user's melee either leaves that melee with their movement action, or uses a ranged attack that doesn't target the user, the user may use this move to perform a Basic Attack on them.

Celestial.Name: Lunar Phase
Celestial.Effect: At the start of a battle, the user picks a Phase. At the start of each turn, the user shifts between Phases in the following order: New Moon (+1 PE/ME) -> Waxing (+1 Range) -> Full Moon (Foes get -1 dice on attacks targeting the user) -> Waning (+1 Dice) -> New, etc. This passive cannot be disabled.

Celestial.Name: Moonblast
Celestial.Effect: The user's next phase effect is doubled.

Celestial.Name: Lunar Shift
Celestial.Effect: The user immediately moves to their next Lunar Phase. If Moonblast's effect is active it's transferred to the new phase.

Celestial.Name: Holy Light
Celestial.Effect: If the user is in Waxing, they gain +1 MP until the end of their next turn.

Celestial.Name: Dark Reflection
Celestial.Effect: Applies the inverse of the user's current phase effect to the target for one round.

Celestial.Name: Harvest Moon
Celestial.Effect: When used while in New Moon or Full Moon Phase, heal the user by 10% of the damage done.

Celestial.Name: Tidal Wave
Celestial.Effect: Targets hit are moved one tile towards the user. This move is affected by the +Range from Waxing Phase

Celestial.Name: Tidal Locking
Celestial.Effect: The user doesn't change phases at the start of their next turn. This move may be used as a non-damaging standard.

Celestial.Name: Blood Moon
Celestial.Effect: If the user is in Waxing or Waning, this move inflicts 5/1 Poison, otherwise it inflicts 5/1 Bleed.

Celestial.Name: Celestial Blessing
Celestial.Effect: All targets in range gain the effect of the user's next phase until the start of the user's next turn. Next turn, the user's phase has no effect, and phase-specific move effects cannot trigger. This is not affected by Moonblast.

Celestial.Name: Gravity Crash
Celestial.Effect:
This move has a different effect based on the phase it's used in:
New Moon: The target is Sealed/1
Waxing (Push 2): If the target can't be pushed fully, they take 15 extra damage.
Full Moon: All the target's AoE moves are single target for one round.
Waning: This attack has bomb dice.

Celestial.Name: Sun Rays
Celestial.Effect: The target is inflicted with unremovable Burn 3/1.

Celestial.Name: Searing Shot
Celestial.Effect: The user's next attack gains +5 damage.

Celestial.Name: Brilliant Flash
Celestial.Effect: Targets who are burned have their Solar Rod Burn extended by one round.

Celestial.Name: Firestorm
Celestial.Effect: If one of the targets missed the user with an attack on their last turn, the user's next attack gains +X damage, where X = 3 * the MR of the attack that missed.

Celestial.Name: Meteor Shower
Celestial.Effect: For every target in range that is Burned, this attack gains a die.

Celestial.Name: Radiant Dawn
Celestial.Effect: If used on a foe, the next time they are Burned, the burn damage is increased by 3. If used on self, the next time the user inflicts Burn, they heal the damage dealt by the burn whenever the foe takes it.

Celestial.Name: Pyroclasm
Celestial.Effect: All targets hit are inflicted with unremovable 3 Burn/1. This move and its burn are immune to outside factors. Do not add MAG to the roll.

Celestial.Name: Supernova
Celestial.Effect: Targets in Burst 1 are inflicted with unremovable 5 Burn/2. Other targets are inflicted with unremovable 5 Burn/1.

Celestial.Name: Conflagration
Celestial.Effect: If this attack has a damage buff from a Solar Rod move applied to it, double the additional damage dealt from it.

Celestial.Name: Solar Flare
Celestial.Effect: This attack gains Bomb Dice against Burned targets.

Celestial.Name: Star Storm
Celestial.Effect: If the target(s), on their next turn, moves towards the user, this deals an additional 1d8 damage.

Celestial.Name: Exotic Star
Celestial.Effect: The user gains Exotic Star. Attacks targeting the user deal 90% damage; Sequence Star is disabled. The user may deactivate this after one round as a Trigger action, but cannot activate another Star that turn.

Celestial.Name: Sequence Star
Celestial.Effect: The user gains Sequence Star. Damage inflicted from the user's Star Rod abilities outside their turn, such as from Orbit, deals 1.2x damage; Exotic Star is disabled. The user may deactivate this after one round as a Trigger action, but cannot activate another Star that turn.

Celestial.Name: Orbit
Celestial.Effect: On their next turn, targets cannot perform attacks that do not target the user (if they are able to target the user). If a target stays within the user's Range 3 on their turn, this deals an additional 2d8+8 damage.

Celestial.Name: Gravitation
Celestial.Effect: The user chooses another player (can be the user, but not the target's allies) in Range 3. If the target does not attack that player on their next turn, they take 2d8+5 damage.

Celestial.Name: White Hole
Celestial.Effect: If the user is in Exotic Star, the target is pushed to a space within the user's Range 4-6. The push must be in the direction of the attack. After using this move, the user's movement action is disabled for the rest of their turn.

Celestial.Name: Black Hole
Celestial.Effect: If the user is in Sequence Star, the target is pulled to a space within the user's Range 2. The pull must be in the direction of the attack.

Celestial.Name: Cosmic Power
Celestial.Effect: If the opponent is able to move to a different tile type before the end of their next turn, but doesn't, this deals an additional 1d8+10 damage and inflicts 6 Cripple/1.

Celestial.Name: Star Bits
Celestial.Effect: If in Exotic Star, and at least 2 hit, the target is inflicted with 3 Cripple/1; if 3 hit, the target is inflicted with 6 Cripple/1. If in Sequence Star, this move has Push X where X = Hits - 1. Do not add MAG. Immune to outside factors.

Celestial.Name: Negative Mass
Celestial.Effect: Targets cannot damage the user from melee range for one round. The user must be in Exotic Star to use this ability.

Celestial.Name: Planetary Nebula
Celestial.Effect: The user can only be damaged from melee for one round. The user must be in Sequence Star to use this ability.

Celestial.Name: Asteroid Belt
Celestial.Effect: If the user is in Exotic Star, ranged attacks on the user lose Xd4 damage for one round, where X is the range the attack was used at (max of 3d4). If in Sequence Star, foes who willingly enter the user's melee range before the user's next turn take 2d8+5 damage. This ability may be used as a Standard to extend the effect's duration by an additional round.

Celestial.Name: Accretion Disc
Celestial.Effect: Targets who end their next turn in the user's Range 3 take 4d8+8 damage.

Clairvoyant.Name: Basic Attack (P) / Basic Attack (M)
Clairvoyant.Effect: A basic attack. The user may choose either BATK (P) or BATK (M). Add the corresponding stat depending on their choice (BATK (P) = Physical Attack. BATK (M) = Magical Attack).This attack can be used even when sealed and its use cannot be prevented by any means, outside of Stun.

Clairvoyant.Name: Dash
Clairvoyant.Effect: The user may move up to 1.5x their MP (rounded down) instead of 1x. (Dash is a Full Action, which takes up both the movement and standard actions.)

Clairvoyant.Name: Backstep
Clairvoyant.Effect: The user moves one tile in a cardinal direction without triggering Attack of Opportunity.  This can only be used when adjacent to a foe.

Clairvoyant.Name: Attack of Opportunity
Clairvoyant.Effect: When a foe in the user's melee either leaves that melee with their movement action, or uses a ranged attack that doesn't target the user, the user may use this move to perform a Basic Attack on them.

Clairvoyant.Name: Future Sight
Clairvoyant.Effect: Delay moves have their damage and effects delayed for a specified number of rounds. Damage is rolled when the move is used, taking +dmg and -dmg effects on the user into account immediately. All delayed moves land regardless of the status of the user, including death or stun.

Clairvoyant.Name: Augur
Clairvoyant.Effect: Before accuracy, the user may choose to give this move Delay-1 for an additional 5 damage or +3 Critical Range on this move, or Delay-2 for both.

Clairvoyant.Name: Echo Burst
Clairvoyant.Effect: Before accuracy, the user may choose to give this move Delay-1. If they do, it loses Splash, but the user gains +5 DR until the move deals damage.

Clairvoyant.Name: Scry
Clairvoyant.Effect: The user gains +5 damage on their next attack. Before accuracy, the user may give this move Delay-1 to extend this attack's Cone by 1.

Clairvoyant.Name: Spirit Shackle
Clairvoyant.Effect: This move has Delay-X, where X is the number of Foes hit. This move is immune to outside factors. This does not add MAG.

Clairvoyant.Name: Dawn Break
Clairvoyant.Effect: This ability has Delay-2. Until this ability hits, all of the user's attacks on the target have -1 MR. The user may increase the Delay by 1 for an additional -1 MR on the target.

Clairvoyant.Name: Prismatic Burst
Clairvoyant.Effect: The user may choose to add Delay-X to this ability to give it +X dice, where X is the amount of targets hit.

Clairvoyant.Name: Omen
Clairvoyant.Effect: The user's next attack has an extra turn of delay with a doubled delay bonus.

Clairvoyant.Name: Foresight
Clairvoyant.Effect: This may be used when the user is attacked, after damage is rolled. After additive damage factors, 15% of the attack's damage is removed and added to all of the user's currently delayed attacks.

Clairvoyant.Name: Prophecy
Clairvoyant.Effect: All the user's currently delayed moves hit at the same time as this attack.

Clairvoyant.Name: Corruption
Clairvoyant.Effect: This attack inflicts 5 Poison/1 on hit. Before accuracy, the user may choose to give this move Delay-1 for extending the Poison duration by 1 round, or Delay-2 for +5 poison damage.

Clairvoyant.Name: Requite
Clairvoyant.Effect: This move has Delay-1 and a Delay bonus of +15 damage if the user dies before this attack hits.

Clairvoyant.Name: Oscillations
Clairvoyant.Effect: The user may have up to three Momentum at once. For each Momentum, the user gains +1 MP. Momentum can be spent regardless of how much MP was used this turn. The user starts each game with 1 Momentum.

Clairvoyant.Name: Entrance
Clairvoyant.Effect: For one round, if the user is targeted by the target, the user gains 1 Momentum. This move can be used even while sealed.

Clairvoyant.Name: Torment
Clairvoyant.Effect: After accuracy, the user may spend 1 Momentum to either extend the effect of the user's next Pendulum Standard/Full by one round (including statuses), or gain 2d8+1 damage (affected by Dowse if used this turn) on the user's next Pendulum Standard/Full.

Clairvoyant.Name: Action and Reaction
Clairvoyant.Effect: This move can only be used at the start of the user's turn. The user permanently sacrifices 1 MP to increase their Momentum cap by 1, preserving their Momentum stacks. The user gains the ability to passively generate 1 Momentum after using a Standard/Full besides Dash. (A maximum of 1 Momentum can be generated per turn.) Dowse is disabled for one round.

Clairvoyant.Name: Dowse
Clairvoyant.Effect: This move can only be used at the start of the user's turn. The user's next Pendulum attack this turn unremovably gains advantage damage rolls on its base dice and -2 damage, but the passive Momentum generation of Action and Reaction is disabled until reactivation.

Clairvoyant.Name: Hallucinations
Clairvoyant.Effect: The user may choose "Dream" or "Nightmare". Dream: The user gains two Momentum, while the target gains +3 DR/1 or +3 DMG/1 (chosen by the user). Nightmare: If the target uses a Once/Twice/Thrice move on their next turn, they take 3d8+5 damage. At the expense of two Momentum, such moves of the target deal 75% damage for one round.

Clairvoyant.Name: Clacker Volley
Clairvoyant.Effect: Both targets are inflicted with Confusion/1. If both targets have successfully hit the user with a Standard/Full attack in the last round, one of them (chosen by the user) is also Sealed/1. The seal's duration cannot be increased.

Clairvoyant.Name: Angular Momentum
Clairvoyant.Effect: The user spends any number of Momentum to gain +2 EVAs per 2 Momentum for one round. The user may choose to spend an additional Momentum to extend this buff's duration to two rounds.

Clairvoyant.Name: Mass Hysteria
Clairvoyant.Effect:
The user can spend 1 Momentum per effect to give this ability any combination of the following effects: 

- Make this attack Burst 2,
- Use this move as a Standard,
- Reduce the damage of the next Standard/Full attack of each target hit by 2d4+3,
- Inflict Confusion/2 to every target hit.

If this attack misses more than one target as a Standard, the user gains one Momentum.

Clairvoyant.Name: Hypnotic Daze
Clairvoyant.Effect: If the target uses a non-Basic, non-Weapon move in the next two rounds, they take 3d6+3 bomb damage. For one Momentum, the target's Frees and Triggers become Swifts for one round. If Dowse was used this turn, this move has +1 ACC.

Clairvoyant.Name: Nihil
Clairvoyant.Effect: If the target does not buff the user on their next turn, they take 7d4+4 damage. The target may target foes in their Range 3 with buffs classified as Self, Ally, Self or Ally, etc. while under this effect. (Buffs whose effect references a Passive have no effect, but fulfill the requirement.)

Clairvoyant.Name: Shatter Psyche
Clairvoyant.Effect: If the target deals 45+ damage on their next turn, they take an additional 4d8+5 damage. The user may decrease the required damage threshold by spending any number of Momentum; each Momentum spent decreases it by 6.

Clairvoyant.Name: Discard
Clairvoyant.Effect: On an accuracy roll of 15+, the user gains 1 Discard stack. As a Reaction to an attack of a Foe within Range 4 after its accuracy roll, the user may spend one stack to give that attack -2 ACC.

Clairvoyant.Name: Maverick
Clairvoyant.Effect: By default, roll a d4 after rolling damage. This determines damage multiplication: 1 = 0.5x, 2 = 1x, 3 = 1.5x, 4 = 2x. The user may choose to not roll the d4 before damage.

Clairvoyant.Name: Roulette
Clairvoyant.Effect: Roll a 1d8 to inflict a random status on the opponent, then roll a d3. If the d3 roll is 1, status the user instead. Statuses: 1 = 10 Bleed/1, 2 = 10 Poison/1, 3 = 10 Burn/1, 4 = Confusion/2, 5 = Seal/1, 6 = Root/1, 7 = 6 Cripple/1, 8 = Stun/1.

Clairvoyant.Name: Dealer
Clairvoyant.Effect: Roll Xd13 where X is the number of players alive. P1 takes the first dice roll as damage, P2 the second roll, etc. This is immune to all outside factors.

Clairvoyant.Name: Gamble
Clairvoyant.Effect: Roll d7. 1 = Subtract the target's ATK and MAG, 2 = Subtract the higher of the target's offensive stats, 3 = Subtract the user's ATK, 4 = Add the user's ATK, 5 = Add the higher of the target's offensive stats, 6 = Add the user's MAG again, 7 = Add the user's ATK and the target's ATK and MAG. This ability is immune to outside factors to damage. (These effects do not count as negative damage factors. This move still adds the user's MAG.)

Clairvoyant.Name: Blackjack
Clairvoyant.Effect: On a successful hit, roll 2d10, treating 1s as either 1 or 11 (user’s choice). The user may choose to roll additional 1d10s to add to the roll. If the total is 17-20, this attack gains 1 base dice. On a total of 21, this attack instead gains 3 base dice. On a total of 22 or higher, the attack instead loses 2 base dice.

Clairvoyant.Name: Hi-Lo
Clairvoyant.Effect: Roll a 1d10. The user has to predict whether the next 1d10 result will be higher or lower than the result. Roll another 1d10, and the user again has to guess whether it will be higher or lower. Continue this until either the user chooses to stop, mispredicts, or correctly guesses 5 times. This attack's roll is Xd10, where X = two times the amount of correct guesses. On a failed guess, the ability loses half of its total base dice.

Clairvoyant.Name: Full House
Clairvoyant.Effect: Roll 3d3. For every 3 rolled, this attack gains +1 die. Only add half MAG.

Clairvoyant.Name: House Advantage
Clairvoyant.Effect: Targets are inflicted with -7 DMG/1. Each target may choose to roll a d10 and a d2 together. If the d2 rolls 1, add the d10 to their debuff, if it rolls 2, subtract it instead.

Clairvoyant.Name: Stacked Deck
Clairvoyant.Effect:
In place of an accuracy roll, roll a 1d14 for an effect. 
1 = Set the user's HP to 1,
2 = The user is Stunned next turn and Stacked Deck deals no damage, 
3 = The opponent is healed by the roll, 
4 = The attack misses, 
5 = 0.5x damage, 
6 = This user takes recoil equal to half the damage dealt by this attack, 
7 = Cleanse all statuses and numerical debuffs from the user & reset their other moves' frequencies,
8 = This attack has bomb dice,
9 = Inflict 5 Burn, Bleed & Poison/1 on the target (stacks with other statuses) for one turn,
10 = The user stores a reroll of a Cards non-1d20 secondary effect,
11 = Inflicts 1.5x damage,
12 = Target is Sealed/1, 
13 = Target is Stunned/1, 
14 = This attack has unremovable thrice dice.

Dark.Name: Basic Attack (P) / Basic Attack (M)
Dark.Effect: A basic attack. The user may choose either BATK (P) or BATK (M). Add the corresponding stat depending on their choice (BATK (P) = Physical Attack. BATK (M) = Magical Attack).This attack can be used even when sealed and its use cannot be prevented by any means, outside of Stun.

Dark.Name: Dash
Dark.Effect: The user may move up to 1.5x their MP (rounded down) instead of 1x. (Dash is a Full Action, which takes up both the movement and standard actions.)

Dark.Name: Backstep
Dark.Effect: The user moves one tile in a cardinal direction without triggering Attack of Opportunity.  This can only be used when adjacent to a foe.

Dark.Name: Attack of Opportunity
Dark.Effect: When a foe in the user's melee either leaves that melee with their movement action, or uses a ranged attack that doesn't target the user, the user may use this move to perform a Basic Attack on them.

Dark.Name: Crimson Pact
Dark.Effect: Whenever the user damages an enemy, they sacrifice HP equal to 10% of the total damage the foe took, if able. Then, they gain permanent bonus damage equal to the damage they took. (Bonus damage is also gained through effect-derived CP.)

Dark.Name: Bloodrush
Dark.Effect: If this move is used in Melee range, before accuracy, the user gains +3 DMG and +1 MP for one round.

Dark.Name: Infusion
Dark.Effect: The user gains Shield for one round equal to the amount of damage they take from Crimson Pact from using this attack.

Dark.Name: Purloin Youth
Dark.Effect: The target suffers -1 Evasions, and the user gains +1 Evasions, for 1 round.  If the target misses their next Standard/Full attack on the user, the user rolls the attack's damage and takes 10% of the roll in Crimson Pact.

Dark.Name: Defile
Dark.Effect: Targets are inflicted with 5 Poison/1. For each target hit the user loses 1 HP to Crimson Pact.

Dark.Name: Black Magic
Dark.Effect: When the user has 8+ CP, they gain +1 MP permanently.  With 12+ CP,  they gain +3 DR permanently.  With 15+ CP, they gain +5 MAG permanently.

Dark.Name: Massacre
Dark.Effect: If an opponent is killed using this move, the CP gained from it is doubled. (Round down the amount gained normally before doubling.)

Dark.Name: Sanctified Blade
Dark.Effect: Crimson Pact's sacrifice amount on the user's next single-target attack is increased by 10%. If the Foe has targeted the user since the beginning of their last turn, the amount is increased by an additional 5%.

Dark.Name: Exsanguinate
Dark.Effect: This move does not benefit from the user's CP damage bonus. The user's current Black Magic buffs are doubled.

Dark.Name: Siphon Soul
Dark.Effect: Bonus damage to this move from Crimson Pact also restores the user's HP.

Dark.Name: Oblation
Dark.Effect: This move gets double bonus damage from Crimson Pact. For one round, the user's moves do not benefit from CP bonus.

Dark.Name: Pact of the Elder
Dark.Effect:
While active, the user's Blood tile creates a Blood Storm effect in Burst 1 of the tile. Foes must use an additional MP to exit the Blood Storm. 

If the user is within Range 3 of their Blood tile, they may choose to have their abilities originate from the Blood tile. By doing so, the attack gains +3 damage and attacks classified as Range/Homing/Line have -1 range.

Dark.Name: Blood Storm
Dark.Effect: The user sacrifices 10 HP to place a Blood tile in Range. The user may not have more than 1 Blood tile at once, and the Blood tile may be removed after 1 round as a Free action. The user's Blood tile cannot be overwritten.

Dark.Name: Tainted Faith
Dark.Effect: This ability inflicts unremovable 5 Poison/1. If this originated from the user's Blood tile, this instead becomes unremovable 7 Poison/1.

Dark.Name: Defiled Tentacles
Dark.Effect: This ability has Pull 2. If this ability originates from the user's Blood tile, it becomes 1/Foe/Range 6 and has Pull 4 instead.

Dark.Name: Accursed Brew
Dark.Effect: This ability gains +1 dice for every Poisoned target in range. If this ability originates from the user's Blood tile, it deals damage to all foes in the user's Blood Storm instead.

Dark.Name: Crimson Rain
Dark.Effect: The next time the user uses Blood Storm or Bloodlet, subtract the damage dealt by this attack from the HP sacrificed (this effect does not stack with itself). This ability is immune to outside factors to damage. Do not add MAG.

Dark.Name: Toxic Blood
Dark.Effect: For 1 round, Foes who enter the user's Blood Storm are inflicted with unremovable 3 Poison/1. If already inflicted with unremovable Poison, increase its damage by 3 and its duration by 1.

Dark.Name: Hemokinesis
Dark.Effect: The user's Blood tile is moved to the tile the target is currently on. This ability may be used as a non-damaging standard to move the Blood tile to a tile in range. The user then loses 5 HP.

Dark.Name: Bloodlet
Dark.Effect: The user sacrifices 7 HP to permanently increase the Burst of their Blood Storm by 1. Until the start of the user's next turn, the user and allies in the user's Blood Storm gain +3 DMG and +1 ACC. A Blood Storm may not increase in size more than once.

Dark.Name: Blood Ties
Dark.Effect: This ability must originate from the user's Blood tile. For 1 round, targets in the user's Blood Storm cannot exit the Blood Storm willingly.

Dark.Name: Price of Power
Dark.Effect: Before accuracy, the user and allies within the Blood Storm may each sacrifice 5 HP to give this ability +1 dice for every 5 HP sacrificed (max of +3 dice).

Dark.Name: Eldritch Horror
Dark.Effect: This ability must originate from the user's Blood tile and deals damage to all Foes in the Blood Storm. Poisoned targets take an additional 1d10+4 damage, and have their Poison extended by 1 round. Non-poisoned targets are inflicted with unremovable 3X Poison/1, -2X DR/1 and -2X DMG/1, where X is the amount of targets in the Blood Storm.

Dark.Name: Reaper's Touch
Dark.Effect: Whenever the user damages a foe, the user heals 1/8 of the damage dealt.

Dark.Name: Reap
Dark.Effect: The user heals an additional 8% of damage dealt.

Dark.Name: Haunted Swing
Dark.Effect: Targets at full HP take an additional 5 damage. The user heals 5 HP for each target this triggers on.

Dark.Name: Pestilent Strike
Dark.Effect: If the user heals 4+ HP from this move, it inflicts -3 Evasions/1.

Dark.Name: Coup de Grâce
Dark.Effect: If this kills a target, the user heals 10 HP and gains +5 damage to their next attack.

Dark.Name: Wither Soul
Dark.Effect: For each target that is currently under a debuff, this deals an additional 3 damage and the user heals 3 HP.

Dark.Name: Hades's Toll
Dark.Effect: For two rounds, the user's Reaper's Touch heal is doubled for attacks against the target.

Dark.Name: Phantasmal Shield
Dark.Effect: For one round, the user heals 10% of the damage taken from all attacks.

Dark.Name: Memento Mori
Dark.Effect: This attack's damage is delayed for one turn. The user may choose to delay it for up to 2 additional turns. For each additional turn delayed, the user heals an additional 1/8 of the damage from Reaper's Touch.

Dark.Name: Spirit Break
Dark.Effect: The target is inflicted with -3 DR/1, and the user gains +3 DMG/1.

Dark.Name: Phantom Blade
Dark.Effect: This move gains +damage equal to amount of HP the user has healed from Scythe abilities since the start of their last turn.

Dueler.Effect: A basic attack. The user may choose either BATK (P) or BATK (M). Add the corresponding stat depending on their choice (BATK (P) = Physical Attack. BATK (M) = Magical Attack).This attack can be used even when sealed and its use cannot be prevented by any means, outside of Stun.
The user may move up to 1.5x their MP (rounded down) instead of 1x. (Dash is a Full Action, which takes up both the movement and standard actions.)
The user moves one tile in a cardinal direction without triggering Attack of Opportunity.  This can only be used when adjacent to a foe.
When a foe in the user's melee either leaves that melee with their movement action, or uses a ranged attack that doesn't target the user, the user may use this move to perform a Basic Attack on them.
The user may switch to Gladius, Scutum or Pilum. (The user starts the game in Gladius).
If the user is Gladius, this deals +3 damage. If Scutum, the user gains 3 DR/1. If Pilum, this move has -1 MR.

If the user is in Pilum, the target is inflicted with Confusion/1, and if the user is in Scutum, the target is inflicted with 5/1 Bleed. If not already in Gladius, the user automatically switches to it.

This move has a different effect depending on the user's weapon.
Gladius = +5 damage
Scutum = The target's next standard/full attack loses 5 damage.
Pilum = This move may be made AoE/Foes/Line 4 instead.

The user must be in Gladius or Pilum to use this move, and may be used as a non-damaging standard on the user. The user automatically switches to Scutum and only takes 75% damage from foes' attacks for one round.

This move has a different effect depending on the user's weapon.
Gladius: The targets' next attack deals additional damage equal to 10% of the damage dealt on the user's last attack.
Scutum: Targets gain DR for one round equal to 15% of the damage that all targets collectively did on their last attacks.
Pilum: The targets' gain bonus accuracy on their next attack equal to 8% (rounded down) of the damage they dealt on their last attack.

The user is pushed back one space. If the user is in Gladius, foes who enter the user's melee before the user's next turn take 5 damage. If the user is in Scutum, the user does not take damage from AoE attacks for one round. The user automatically switches to Pilum.

This move has a different range and effect depending on the user's weapon.
Gladius: One/Foe/Melee range, and inflicts 10 Bleed/1
Scutum: AoE/Foes/Cone 2, and has 3 Push
Pilum: AoE/Foes/Line 3, and inflicts 6 Cripple/1
If the user is under the effects of Dual Wield, the user may pick any range and effect from their two weapon effects from this move.
The user benefits from the effects of any two weapons (Gladius/Scutum/Pilum) this turn, they regain the effects of only the original weapon after the end of their turn.

If the user is in Gladius, the user gains 15% of this attack's damage as +damage for one round. If the user is in Scutum, the user gains immunity to statuses and debuffs for one round and is cured from them (before accuracy). If the user is in Pilum, the target's evasions are reduced to 0 for one round.
This attack gains +2X dice where X is the amount of times the user has used (i. e. targeted someone with a gladius ability) their least used weapon.

For every 25% (rounded down) below the user's max HP, gain 1 Enrage counter. (Each counter can only be acquired once, even if the user heals above a 25% threshold.) 
Katana abilities have bonus dice equal to the amount of Enrage counters the user has.
If the user has 1 Enrage counter, this attack may be used when sealed. If the user has at least 2 Enrage counters, this may be used regardless of any statuses or move effects (except stun).
For every enrage counter the user has, this move gains +1 ACC. The user moves as close to the target as possible.
If the target doesn't roll at least 35 damage with an attack that targets the user on their next turn the user gains one Enrage counter.

The user gains +damage on their next standard/full attack equal to X% of the damage they took from one of the targets since the beginning of the user's last turn. X is ten times the amount of Enrage counters the user has. If the user has at least 2 Enrage counters this ability may be used as a Trigger action, but Revenge can only be used once per turn.
If this attack kills the target, the user gains one Enrage counter and another use on this move.
The user takes X more damage from all attacks until the start of their next turn, where X is 10 minus twice the amount of the Enrage counters the user has (minimum 0).

If the user has at least one Enrage counter, they are cleansed from any statuses and debuffs (before accuracy). If they have two counters, the user can choose for this move to be Aoe/Foes/Burst 1. If they have 3, this move can be Burst 2.
The user gains a Shield equal to X% of this attack's damage, where X is five times the amount of Enrage counters the user has.
This attack has doubled bonus dice from Fallen Blade, and the user takes recoil equal to the damage dealt by the extra bonus dice. If the recoil would kill the user, they are left at 1 HP instead.
If the target has at least 40 more HP than the user, Fallen Blade dice on this move are converted into bonus damage equal to ten times the number of Enrage counters the user has.
This attack can be used even when sealed.

This move may be used on a foe hitting the user in Melee range, after accuracy has been rolled. The foe's attack loses 3 damage (5 damage if the player used Feint on their last turn). This ability is immune to non-Rapier outside factors to damage and does not add ATK.

The user moves to a spot adjacent, but not diagonally, to the target. If the user cannot enter the target's Melee, they move as close to the target as possible. If the target was at full HP, they are inflicted with 5 Bleed/1.

This move may be used on a foe attacking the user from range, after accuracy has been rolled. The user gains 2 DR (4 DR if the user is under the effects of En Garde) for the duration of the attack this is used on. This ability is immune to non-Rapier outside factors to damage and does not add ATK.
The user's next Reaction deals an additional 1d6+5 damage.
For one round, the user gains 5 DR, and their Reaction moves become MR 0.
The user's Reaction abilities ignore evasions for one round.
This may be used on a foe in melee range that missed an attack on the user. This ability is immune to non-Rapier outside factors to damage and does not add ATK.

The user picks Fast or Slow. Fast: The user's next Reaction grants them +2 evasions until the end of the target's next turn. Slow: The user's next reaction gives them 10 DR for the duration of the attack it is used on.

This move may be used when a foe targeting the user would deal 40+ damage before damage reducing effects on an attack that hits the user. This ability is immune to non-Rapier outside factors to damage and does not add ATK.

Fighter.Name: Basic Attack (P) / Basic Attack (M)
Fighter.Effect: A basic attack. The user may choose either BATK (P) or BATK (M). Add the corresponding stat depending on their choice (BATK (P) = Physical Attack. BATK (M) = Magical Attack).This attack can be used even when sealed and its use cannot be prevented by any means, outside of Stun.

Fighter.Name: Dash
Fighter.Effect: The user may move up to 1.5x their MP (rounded down) instead of 1x. (Dash is a Full Action, which takes up both the movement and standard actions.)

Fighter.Name: Backstep
Fighter.Effect: The user moves one tile in a cardinal direction without triggering Attack of Opportunity.  This can only be used when adjacent to a foe.

Fighter.Name: Attack of Opportunity
Fighter.Effect: When a foe in the user's melee either leaves that melee with their movement action, or uses a ranged attack that doesn't target the user, the user may use this move to perform a Basic Attack on them.

Fighter.Name: Stance Change
Fighter.Effect: At the start of their turn, the user may choose to become "Attack Stance", which grants +3 damage on attacks, "Defense Stance", which grants +3 DR, or "Neutral Stance". The user starts the game in "Neutral Stance", which confers no bonuses.

Fighter.Name: Flowing Strike
Fighter.Effect: If the user is in Attack Stance, this move is Range 4, and targets 1 Foe. If the user is in Defense Stance, this move is Burst 1 and AoE. If the user is in both Attack and Defence stance, this attack is Range 4 and has Splash 1.

Fighter.Name: Sweep
Fighter.Effect: If the user is in Attack Stance, this attack inflicts -2 Evasions/1. If the user is in Defense Stance, the user gains +2 Evasions/1.

Fighter.Name: Whirlwind
Fighter.Effect: If the user is in Attack Stance, the foe is pushed back 3 spaces. If the user is in Defense Stance, the user is pushed back 3 spaces. If the user is in Neutral Stance, the user and target are pushed back 1 space each.

Fighter.Name: Steady Strike
Fighter.Effect: Before accuracy, if the user is in Attack Stance, both the user's and the target's debuffs are removed, if the user is in Defense Stance, both the user's and the target's buffs (including stance effects) are removed, and if the user is in Neutral Stance, the user's debuffs and the target's buffs are removed.

Fighter.Name: Impeding Grip
Fighter.Effect: If the user is in Attack Stance, the user's attacks have +2 range this turn, and if the user is in Defense Stance, attacks that would target the user have -2 range for one round.

Fighter.Name: Reprisal
Fighter.Effect: If the user is in Attack Stance, their next attack against the target deals an additional 1d8+9 damage. If the user is in Defense Stance, the user gains a 1d8+9 shield.

Fighter.Name: Defiance
Fighter.Effect: If the user is in Attack Stance, their accuracy rolls gain Advantage; if the user is in Defense Stance, accuracy rolls against them gain Disadvantage. Both effects last until the start of the user's next turn. If in both stances, the user may choose which effect to gain. The user may not have both effects at once.

Fighter.Name: Volatile Swing
Fighter.Effect: If the user is in Attack Stance, this move has bomb dice. If the user is in Defense Stance, the opponent has inverse bomb dice (the attack affected rolls bomb, but the extra rolls of bomb are instead deducted from the total damage of the attack) for two rounds.

Fighter.Name: Reverse Strike
Fighter.Effect: The user is locked into their current stance, and their stance's bonus is inverted, for one round. This move cannot be used in Neutral Stance.

Fighter.Name: Martial Art
Fighter.Effect: Starting after the accuracy roll, the user is in both Attack and Defense Stance for one round. When using a move with different effects depending on the user's stance, both effects apply, unless specified.

Fighter.Name: Gouge
Fighter.Effect: The target is inflicted with 3 Bleed/1. This bleed is unremovable.

Fighter.Name: Animal Instinct
Fighter.Effect: Each standard by the user that would involve at least one Claws ability is split into two Claws standards, with all effects that would affect both, including effects that would affect the user's "next attack" and normally unremovable effects, being applied to both. If any such effect is an additive damage/dice effect (including ATK/MAG), it is halved beforehand, rounding up on the first standard that would be affected and down on the second.

Fighter.Name: Pounce
Fighter.Effect: The user moves as close to the target as possible. The user may choose to lose their next standard this turn to add their full ATK instead and increase range to 7.

Fighter.Name: Crippling Slash
Fighter.Effect: The user's attacks against the target have +2 ACC for one round.

Fighter.Name: Fury Swipes
Fighter.Effect: This move ignores outside negative damage factors.

Fighter.Name: Close Combat
Fighter.Effect: If used on the same turn as Fury Swipes, any bleed the target has is extended for another turn.

Fighter.Name: Gyre
Fighter.Effect: The user may choose to lose their second standard, but add their full ATK stat to this attack instead. If they do, this move's range is Cone 2 instead.

Fighter.Name: Frenzy
Fighter.Effect: If the target is bleeding, this move has bomb dice.

Fighter.Name: Vengeance
Fighter.Effect: If the user's previous standard missed, inflict (or, if already bleeding, increase to) unremovable bleed on the target to 10/1 and its effect to -10 damage.

Fighter.Name: Heartseek
Fighter.Effect: This move has X dice, where X is the number of times the target has been hit by the user. (Maximum 10d8; multi-hit attacks only add 1 die.)

Fighter.Name: Shred
Fighter.Effect: If the target is bleeding, this move automatically crits if it hits.

Fighter.Name: Disarm
Fighter.Effect: The target(s) lose 1 die on their next (non 0-dice) Standard/Full attack. Every other time this is used on a target (2nd, 4th etc), the target also loses 1 accuracy on their next attack.

Fighter.Name: Spurn Shot
Fighter.Effect: If the target is able to, but doesn't use an attack that targets the user from melee on their next turn, the user can AoO them.

Fighter.Name: Figure 8
Fighter.Effect: The user may use this attack instead of a Basic Attack for AoOs. If used as an AoO, this cannot be ignored by abilities other than Backstep.

Fighter.Name: Evasive Stance
Fighter.Effect: For one round, gain +3 Evasions. During the next turn, deal -10 damage on all attacks.

Fighter.Name: Hold Over
Fighter.Effect: Declare 1 range type (excluding Melee). The user may not be targeted by foes with attacks of this range type unless they are in melee for one round. (Abilities with range modifiers, including Splash, Pull, and Push, are not treated as separate range types as abilities without range modifiers.)

Fighter.Name: Yin Yang
Fighter.Effect: Choose Yin or Yang. Yin: Physical/Melee. If the target does not deal damage to the user during the next round, deal an extra 1d8+5 damage. Yang: Magical/Homing 4. If the user takes damage from foes' attacks during the next round, deal an extra 1d8+5 damage to the foe per attack.

Fighter.Name: Standoff
Fighter.Effect: During the next round, if the target ends their next turn adjacent to the user, deal an additional 1d10+2+(1/2ATK) damage at the beginning of the user's next turn.

Fighter.Name: Block
Fighter.Effect: This may be used when the user is attacked, after damage is rolled. After additive damage factors, 1/3 of the attack's damage is removed.

Fighter.Name: Dazing Hook
Fighter.Effect: If the user was attacked outside the user's melee last round by the target, inflict the target with Seal/1. This attack's range cannot be reduced by any ability or effect.

Fighter.Name: Gale Force
Fighter.Effect: The user may choose to move any targets to any unoccupied space in range. Do not check accuracy and roll damage for allies or the user.

Heavy.Name: Basic Attack (P) / Basic Attack (M)
Heavy.Effect: A basic attack. The user may choose either BATK (P) or BATK (M). Add the corresponding stat depending on their choice (BATK (P) = Physical Attack. BATK (M) = Magical Attack).This attack can be used even when sealed and its use cannot be prevented by any means, outside of Stun.

Heavy.Name: Dash
Heavy.Effect: The user may move up to 1.5x their MP (rounded down) instead of 1x. (Dash is a Full Action, which takes up both the movement and standard actions.)

Heavy.Name: Backstep
Heavy.Effect: The user moves one tile in a cardinal direction without triggering Attack of Opportunity.  This can only be used when adjacent to a foe.

Heavy.Name: Attack of Opportunity
Heavy.Effect: When a foe in the user's melee either leaves that melee with their movement action, or uses a ranged attack that doesn't target the user, the user may use this move to perform a Basic Attack on them.

Heavy.Name: Bloodlust
Heavy.Effect: Whenever the user deals 15+ damage with an attack, or takes 15+ damage due to a foe's attack, they gain 1 stack of Rage, max 4.

Heavy.Name: Feral Chop
Heavy.Effect: This inflicts +1 damage for each Rage stack the user has.

Heavy.Name: Power Swing
Heavy.Effect: The user may spend any number of Rage. This move's MR is lowered by 1 for every stack of Rage spent.

Heavy.Name: Brutal Strike
Heavy.Effect: The user may consume stacks of Rage. For every stack consumed, this attack gains +2 critical hit range.

Heavy.Name: Chain Axe
Heavy.Effect: The user gains an additional stack of Rage from this attack.

Heavy.Name: Sever
Heavy.Effect: The user may spend stacks of Rage. For every stack consumed, this attack gains +1 hit.

Heavy.Name: Vindictive
Heavy.Effect: The user gains two stacks of Rage every time they kill a foe.

Heavy.Name: Wide Slash
Heavy.Effect: The user may spend two Rage stacks to make this attack Cone 2.

Heavy.Name: Gash
Heavy.Effect: The target is inflicted with Bleed 5/1. The user may consume up to two stacks of Rage when they use this attack, before accuracy. For every stack consumed, the bleed lasts an additional round.

Heavy.Name: Franciscate
Heavy.Effect: The user is inflicted with Seal/1. They may spend 1 stack before accuracy to negate this status.

Heavy.Name: Amped Strike
Heavy.Effect: This attack deals an additional X damage, where X = the number of Rage stacks the user has * 4. On a hit, the user then loses all of their Rage stacks.

Heavy.Name: Cyclone Sweep
Heavy.Effect: X = 1 + the number of targets hit.

Heavy.Name: Storm Strike
Heavy.Effect: The user moves as close to the original target as possible, and the original target is Slowed/1.

Heavy.Name: Masonry
Heavy.Effect: The user may choose any unoccupied space in range and create a Stone tile there. This tile has 1 HP, 2/2 EVAs and may be targeted for attacks.

Heavy.Name: Crush
Heavy.Effect: The target is pushed 2 tiles away. If the target cannot be pushed the full distance, this attack deals an extra 1d10+4. This extra damage is also dealt to the obstruction, if it is an entity.

Heavy.Name: Earth Render
Heavy.Effect: Within Burst 2 of the melee target, the user may choose to replace up to 3 unoccupied tiles with broken. These broken tiles last 3 rounds, until the user decides to remove them, or until the user dies.

Heavy.Name: Lagging Spin
Heavy.Effect: The user may select one target within range. This move gains extra dice equal to the target's MP minus the user's MP, but no less than 0. Max +3 dice.

Heavy.Name: Fissure
Heavy.Effect: The target is Slowed/1. Foes in Line 3 behind the target take half the damage rolled and are Slowed/1.

Heavy.Name: Shockwave Slam
Heavy.Effect: The user may push any foe within Burst 2 of the target one space away from the target.

Heavy.Name: Gravity Slam
Heavy.Effect: Before accuracy, the user may choose an entity within Splash 2 and pull into any tile in Splash 1. This pull ignores the user.

Heavy.Name: Heavy Weapon
Heavy.Effect: The user has +1 accuracy on all ranged attacks, but cannot use Backstep.

Heavy.Name: Tomahawk Toss
Heavy.Effect: If used from full range, this attack has +4 damage.

Heavy.Name: Kip Up
Heavy.Effect: This may only be used if the user has targeted a Foe/Ally in Melee range in the last round. The target is pushed up to 3 tiles (If the target is the user, user chooses direction). The user's movement action is then disabled for the rest of their turn.

Heavy.Name: Piercing Blow
Heavy.Effect: The target is inflicted with 2 Bleed/1. If used in melee, the bleed is increased to 7/1.

Heavy.Name: Focused Fling
Heavy.Effect: This move has a MR of X, where X = 5 - The range this move is used at.

Heavy.Name: Kinetic Throw
Heavy.Effect: This attack has X - 1 dice, where X is the range this move is used at.

Heavy.Name: Repulse Slice
Heavy.Effect: Foes cannot enter the user's melee for one round.

Heavy.Name: Continental Crash
Heavy.Effect: The user may replace two unoccupied tiles adjacent to them with broken. Foes who end their turn with at least one of these brokens in melee take 10 damage. These tiles revert back to the original after 3 rounds, or when the user dies.

Heavy.Name: Two-Handed
Heavy.Effect: This attack has Splash 1 if used outside of Range 3.

Heavy.Name: Line-Out
Heavy.Effect: This attack inflicts +4 damage on the second target in the line and +8 on the third.

Heavy.Name: Razor Rust
Heavy.Effect: The target is inflicted with 6 Cripple/1.

Heavy.Name: Supreme Strike
Heavy.Effect: This attack can only be used from maximum range, and gains +dice equal to the number of times the user has pushed any foe with weapon abilities.

Regal.Name: Basic Attack (P) / Basic Attack (M)
Regal.Effect: A basic attack. The user may choose either BATK (P) or BATK (M). Add the corresponding stat depending on their choice (BATK (P) = Physical Attack. BATK (M) = Magical Attack).This attack can be used even when sealed and its use cannot be prevented by any means, outside of Stun.

Regal.Name: Dash
Regal.Effect: The user may move up to 1.5x their MP (rounded down) instead of 1x. (Dash is a Full Action, which takes up both the movement and standard actions.)

Regal.Name: Backstep
Regal.Effect: The user moves one tile in a cardinal direction without triggering Attack of Opportunity.  This can only be used when adjacent to a foe.

Regal.Name: Attack of Opportunity
Regal.Effect: When a foe in the user's melee either leaves that melee with their movement action, or uses a ranged attack that doesn't target the user, the user may use this move to perform a Basic Attack on them.

Regal.Name: Brave Leader
Regal.Effect: If able, the user sacrifices an amount of HP equal to the roll to gain the same amount as a shield that lasts until the beginning of the user's next turn. This can only be used if the user doesn't already have a shield from Brave Leader. Effects that depend on the user having a shield from Brave Leader last only until the shield is broken or expires.

Regal.Name: Engage
Regal.Effect: If the user has a shield from Brave Leader, they heal for half of the shield's value.

Regal.Name: Ambush
Regal.Effect: If the user has a shield from Brave Leader, attacks targeting the user lose 1 dice. Otherwise, this attack has +1 dice.

Regal.Name: Diversion
Regal.Effect: If the user has a shield from Brave Leader, they have +2 EVAs.

Regal.Name: Bastion
Regal.Effect: This turn, Brave Leader generates 50% more shield than usual.

Regal.Name: War of Attrition
Regal.Effect: If the user has a shield from Brave Leader, any Foe who hits them in the next round is immediately (before damage is dealt) inflicted 5 Bleed/1.

Regal.Name: Blockade
Regal.Effect: This move is immune to outside factors to damage. Do not add ATK. If the user has a shield from Brave Leader, the shield expires one turn later than it normally would and the user has +1 MP.

Regal.Name: Divide et Impera
Regal.Effect: If the user has a shield from Brave Leader, they lose the shield to gain an equivalent amount of DR for the rest of the shield's duration. For the purposes of move effects, having this DR is considered as having a shield from Brave Leader.

Regal.Name: War Cry
Regal.Effect: If the user has a shield from Brave Leader, allies in range gain a shield of equal value that lasts for one round. This move may be used as a non-damaging standard.

Regal.Name: Shock and Awe
Regal.Effect: If the user has a shield from Brave Leader, attacks targeting them are immune to positive outside factors to accuracy and damage.

Regal.Name: Last Stand
Regal.Effect: The user gains a Shield/1 equal to the amount of shield they have generated with Brave Leader until the beginning of this turn.

Regal.Name: Echoes of Time
Regal.Effect: Damage over Time (DoT) effects deal damage at the start of the affected Entity's turn and last for the specified duration, even if the user dies. All DoT effects are rolled each time they deal damage. The user can only inflict a Foe with one new DoT effect per turn.

Regal.Name: Galdr
Regal.Effect: This move inflicts 2d6+2 DoT on the original target for 2 rounds.

Regal.Name: Astral Projection
Regal.Effect: This move deals no damage. On hit, inflict the targets with DoT equal to the roll for one round. This move is immune to outside damage factors. Only add half MAG.

Regal.Name: Jera
Regal.Effect: Before accuracy, the user's active DoT effects on the target are extended by 1 round. On hit, the target takes double damage from the user's DoT for 1 round. Do not add MAG.

Regal.Name: Oath of Harmony
Regal.Effect: Whenever the target attacks a foe, they heal 15% of the damage dealt. When hitting multiple foes, only heal for 15% of the highest damage dealt to one. Only one target can be affected at a time. This effect only ends once the target dies, and does not stack.

Regal.Name: Oath of Discord
Regal.Effect: The target takes 10% more damage from all attacks. Only one target can be affected at a time. This effect only ends once the target dies, and does not stack.

Regal.Name: Sealed Fate
Regal.Effect: This move inflicts 2d4+5 DoT on the targets for 2 rounds. If neither hit misses a target, that target has -1 Evasions until this move's DoT expires.

Regal.Name: Hagalaz
Regal.Effect: This move deals no damage. On hit, inflict the target with DoT equal to the roll for 2 rounds. This move is immune to outside damage factors. Do not add MAG.

Regal.Name: Crippling Ailment
Regal.Effect:
Choose Isaz or Kenaz. Isaz: Homing 5. The target is inflicted with -2 EVAs/1 and 
-3 DR/1. Kenaz: Line 5. The user's active DoT effects on the target are extended by 1 round. Until those DoT effects expire, the target is inflicted with -2 ACC and -3 DMG.

Regal.Name: Inveita
Regal.Effect: The target is healed for the amount rolled. As a Standard, add the user's MAG to the roll.

Regal.Name: Magic Circle
Regal.Effect: For one round, the user and allies in range have +2 MP, deal an additional 20% attack damage to targets affected by the user's Oath of Discord, and heal an additional 30% of damage dealt with attacks while affected by the user's Oath of Harmony.

Regal.Name: Ragnarök
Regal.Effect: This attack gains +damage equal to one quarter of the damage the user has dealt to foes with DoT this game.

Regal.Name: Solomon's Wisdom
Regal.Effect: The target gains 1d8+5 damage to their next attack. A player cannot gain this buff again if they currently have this buff. Only two players can have this buff from the user at the same time (self and one ally).

Regal.Name: Smite
Regal.Effect: This attack gains 1 die if the target has used or received a buff at any point during the game.

Regal.Name: Enlighten
Regal.Effect: This move can be used when an ally in range attacks or is attacked, before accuracy is rolled. The user's non-permanent buffs are transferred to the target for the rest of their duration. The target is also healed 5 HP.

Regal.Name: Blessing of Kings
Regal.Effect: The user gains +1 ACC and +3 DR for one round.

Regal.Name: Purify
Regal.Effect: The target heals the amount rolled and all the debuffs on the target are removed

Regal.Name: Divine Merit
Regal.Effect: 10% of the damage dealt by this attack is gained as +DMG for 1 round.

Regal.Name: Indulgence
Regal.Effect: The target gains two of the following buffs (chosen by the user) for one round: +2 ACC, +5 DR, +3 DMG, +2 Crit Range. The player cannot gain this buff again if they currently have this buff.

Regal.Name: Tempting Fate
Regal.Effect: The user is inflicted with -3 DMG and -1 ACC for one round. If the user rolls 16+ on accuracy on one of the hits, these effects are negated. If the user rolls 16+ on accuracy on both hits, the debuffs are instead inverted.

Regal.Name: Absolution
Regal.Effect: Before accuracy, the user loses all of their buffs and cannot gain any until the start of their next turn.

Regal.Name: Siphon
Regal.Effect: Before accuracy, the target's non-permanent buffs are transferred to the user.

Regal.Name: Echo of Light
Regal.Effect: After this move deals damage, the user's non-multiplicative buffs obtained through the user's Talisman abilities are doubled and extended by one round. These buffs may not be further increased in duration until their effects end.

Sorcerer.Name: Basic Attack (P) / Basic Attack (M)
Sorcerer.Effect: A basic attack. The user may choose either BATK (P) or BATK (M). Add the corresponding stat depending on their choice (BATK (P) = Physical Attack. BATK (M) = Magical Attack).This attack can be used even when sealed and its use cannot be prevented by any means, outside of Stun.

Sorcerer.Name: Dash
Sorcerer.Effect: The user may move up to 1.5x their MP (rounded down) instead of 1x. (Dash is a Full Action, which takes up both the movement and standard actions.)

Sorcerer.Name: Backstep
Sorcerer.Effect: The user moves one tile in a cardinal direction without triggering Attack of Opportunity.  This can only be used when adjacent to a foe.

Sorcerer.Name: Attack of Opportunity
Sorcerer.Effect: When a foe in the user's melee either leaves that melee with their movement action, or uses a ranged attack that doesn't target the user, the user may use this move to perform a Basic Attack on them.

Sorcerer.Name: Terraform
Sorcerer.Effect: The user places up to three Forest or three Water tiles in their Cone 1. (This cannot replace Ice tiles.)

Sorcerer.Name: Rototill
Sorcerer.Effect: If the target is on a non-Normal tile, this attack loses Pull 3 but gains +1 ACC and +1 dice.

Sorcerer.Name: Blackthorn
Sorcerer.Effect: Before damage, positive tile effects are inverted on targets for one round. Damage on targets in Splash range ignores negative outside factors to damage. The user chooses whether this attack is Physical or Magical.

Sorcerer.Name: Windstorm
Sorcerer.Effect: Targets are pushed in the direction of the cone. For one round, all tiles in range gain the unignorable properties of Air and Sticky tiles. This may be used as a non-damaging Standard targeting only tiles in range.

Sorcerer.Name: Bioturbation
Sorcerer.Effect: The user gains +1 ACC and +5 DMG on their next turn if the target does not move to a different tile type on their turn.

Sorcerer.Name: Bloom
Sorcerer.Effect: For one round, Normal tiles in range grant +1 ACC to the user and allies and -3 DMG to foes. (This effect does not stack.)

Sorcerer.Name: Gelid Wrath
Sorcerer.Effect: All unoccupied Water and Lava tiles in range become Ice for two rounds. This can be used as a non-damaging Swift targetting only tiles in range. Foes who end their turn with at least one of these Ice tiles in their melee take 10 damage. This ability cannot be used diagonally.

Sorcerer.Name: Wildfire
Sorcerer.Effect: If the target's tile is Forest, that tile gains "Wildfire". This unignorable property instantly spreads to all Forest tiles cardinally adjacent to Wildfire. After two rounds, Wildfire Forest tiles are converted to Normal tiles. (Wildfire = Inflicts 10 DMG and -1 EVA/1 on the start of the occupying player's turn).

Sorcerer.Name: Flower Crown
Sorcerer.Effect: Targets on Forest tiles gain +10% DMG/1, while targets on Water tiles heal 4d4 HP.

Sorcerer.Name: Nature's Madness
Sorcerer.Effect: Each Air and Sticky tile (including Windstorm properties) in the user's Burst 1 increases the Range and Amount of Targets of this attack by 1 (Max. 3). This attack also inflicts X Bleed, Poison or Burn / 1 (user's choice), where X = Number of Forest, Water or Lava tiles in Burst 1, respectively. Extend the status duration by one round if there are four or more such tiles in Burst 1. After damage, these tiles are converted to Normal. This attack is immune to Air tiles.

Sorcerer.Name: Scorched Earth
Sorcerer.Effect: After accuracy, tiles in the target's Star 1 become Lava tiles. Lava from this move cannot be ignored, nor can entities take damage for entering more than once per round.

Sorcerer.Name: Fireball
Sorcerer.Effect: On an accuracy roll of 16+, the target is inflicted with 3 Burn/1.

Sorcerer.Name: Frost Hex
Sorcerer.Effect: All attacks on the target have +2 accuracy for one round.

Sorcerer.Name: Lightning
Sorcerer.Effect: Do not add MAG to the roll. This ability is immune to outside factors.

Sorcerer.Name: Fog
Sorcerer.Effect: Targets' ranged attacks have halved range (rounded up) until the end of their next turn. This ability only adds half MAG.

Sorcerer.Name: Faith
Sorcerer.Effect: The target heals the amount rolled for two turns.

Sorcerer.Name: Sandstorm
Sorcerer.Effect: Targets deal -25% damage on their next standard/full attack.

Sorcerer.Name: Plague
Sorcerer.Effect: If this attack hits, the user chooses Bleed, Burn or Poison. The target is inflicted with 5 [Chosen Status]/2.

Sorcerer.Name: Tornado
Sorcerer.Effect: The user swaps locations with the target, ignoring AoOs. On their next turn, the target has +1 MP.

Sorcerer.Name: Focus
Sorcerer.Effect: The user’s next Spellbook attack deals -12 damage, and has its secondary effect doubled. (In the case of statuses, only duration is doubled.)

Sorcerer.Name: Maelstrom
Sorcerer.Effect: On the user's next turn, the user may choose to gain +10 damage, +3 accuracy, or +2 MP for that turn.

Sorcerer.Name: Magic Shot
Sorcerer.Effect: The user may sacrifice up to 4 HP to gain an equivalent amount of damage on this attack.

Sorcerer.Name: Ethereal Blast
Sorcerer.Effect: This attack ignores all obstructions in its path and cannot have its range reduced by Air tiles or Personal Bubble. The user sacrifices 4 HP for each ignored obstruction.

Sorcerer.Name: Energise
Sorcerer.Effect: The user sacrifices 8 HP to gain +1 MP and +2 dice on their next attack this turn.

Sorcerer.Name: Mana Cycle
Sorcerer.Effect: Whenever the user misses a Standard/Full attack, they heal all the HP they sacrificed for that attack through weapon abilities, including HP payed through Trigger/Free/Swift actions. Sacrificed HP healed by Mana Cycle does not contribute to Arcane Protection.

Sorcerer.Name: Blight
Sorcerer.Effect: The user may sacrifice 4 HP to inflict the target with 5 Poison/1, and an additional 4 HP to either increase the Poison damage by 5 or to extend its duration by 1 Round.

Sorcerer.Name: Mana Missiles
Sorcerer.Effect: On accuracy rolls of 16+ this move gains an additional hit (max of 6 total hits). The user may sacrifice up to 8 HP to gain half that amount as +accuracy on this attack. This move is immune to outside factors to accuracy.

Sorcerer.Name: Arcane Spike
Sorcerer.Effect: The user may sacrifice 4 HP to make this ability ignore DR, or 8 HP to ignore all negative outside factors to damage.

Sorcerer.Name: Light Beam
Sorcerer.Effect: The user may sacrifice 4 HP to increase this move's range by 2 or 8 HP to make this move's range Burst 2 instead of Beam 2.

Sorcerer.Name: Arcane Protection
Sorcerer.Effect: The target gains X Shield/1, where X is the amount of HP the user has sacrificed through weapon abilities since the beginning of their last turn.

Sorcerer.Name: Counterspell
Sorcerer.Effect: This move may be used when the user would be inflicted with a status or debuff from an enemy. The user sacrifices 4 HP to negate the status/debuff or to inflict the status/debuff on the opponent, or 8 HP to do both.

Sorcerer.Name: Terra Storm
Sorcerer.Effect: This attack gains +DMG equal to half the HP the user has sacrificed through weapon abilities during the previous 2 rounds.
